hero.subtitle: No need for CLI commands. See, compare, and sync your database schemas easily.

roadmap.title: Future Plan
roadmap.subtitle: Making The Andb a professional tool for everyone.

focus.pg_desc: Supporting advanced MySQL features like Triggers and Events. Making it perfect.
focus.safe_desc: Refactoring the internal engine. Making it ready for any database in the future.

strategy.title: Our Plan
strategy.comm_desc: Core tool is free. Supports MySQL & Postgres. For everyone.
strategy.pro_desc: Advanced features: SSH, Safe Mode, and Team tools.

arch.title: Designed for Reliability
arch.subtitle: Modular design. Fast. Reliable.
arch.core_desc: The brain. It handles connections, comparison, and script generation. Works everywhere.
arch.cli_desc: For automation. Great for CI/CD pipelines.
arch.gui_desc: For humans. Beautiful, fast, and easy to use.

guide.mac_fix_desc: Seeing a "damaged" error? This is normal for new apps not on the App Store. Our code is Open Source and safe.
guide.mac_fix_step: To fix it, run this in
guide.mac_fix_note: This allows the app to open.

demo.title: See it in Action
demo.subtitle: Experience the most intuitive way to visualize, compare, and sync your database schemas.
demo.placeholder_note: User is currently recording... placeholder ready.

story.p1_start: After years as a backend developer, I kept hitting the same wall:
story.p1_end: Manually comparing schemas, missing columns, changed data types, silent production breaks... the risks only grow as your project evolves.
story.p2_start: I realized that while code has Git and CI/CD, the database side was still manual and fragile. I asked myself:
story.p2_quote: "Can I build a version control tool for DDL, like Git does for code?"
story.p3_start: What started as a small CLI tool to solve my own pains has evolved into
story.p3_end: It’s a developer-first tool built to restore trust and visibility in your migrations.
story.milestone_note: 2025 Milestone — From CLI only to a Solid UI

journey.title: The Journey
journey.subtitle: From a frustrated backend developer's idea to a complete ecosystem.
journey.m1_desc: Moving beyond the CLI. Developed a high-performance desktop interface with SQLite-backed metadata storage, Master Password protection, and real-time schema visualization.
journey.m2_desc: The first working prototype. Built the atomic comparison engine and DDL export logic in Node.js. Focus was 100% on stability.
journey.m3_desc: After one too many broken production deployments due to schema mismatches, the idea was born:
journey.m3_quote: Code has Git. Why doesn't the database?
